conclusion: Choose a convenient sign convention with upward as positive.
Define x as the change of the spring length, positive when compressed, and T as the tension in the rope.
Block B stays on the floor, fixing the lower end of the spring, so x is the vertical displacement of block A.
Initial equilibrium with mass of C = m.
Forces on C: T - mg = 0, therefore T = mg.
Forces on A: T + kx₁ - 2mg = 0, insert T = mg to get kx₁ = mg, hence x₁ = mg/k.
Final equilibrium with mass of C = 5m.
Forces on C: T - 5mg = 0, therefore T = 5mg.
Forces on A: T + kx₂ - 2mg = 0, insert T = 5mg to get kx₂ = -3mg, hence x₂ = -3mg/k.
Calculate change of spring length: Δx = x₂ - x₁ = (-3mg/k) - (mg/k) = -4mg/k.
Δx is negative, meaning block A moves upward. Height risen by A is h = |Δx| = 4mg/k.
The block A rises h = 4mg / k.
